header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Tidying out a cupboard, Memories of our ‘gardening set’ toy, Memories of our ‘Bako’ building set, Issues around tidying out, Weather

body.u: so what do you want to do this afternoon when we get over to your house?
well we can have a look in one of those another one of those top cupboards
mm
to see what erm ancient treasures there are
mm I favour that top cupboard on the right because I think there might be toys in there and could it be possible that the garden set is in there? you know what I mean by the garden set?
mm with the little pieces of er brown er well rectangles of brown plastic with holes in but but er
it was quite like chocolate really wasn't it?
yes well it was a bit undulating
mm
and which you use a little erm plastic thing that looks like a fork or spade handle
mm
with a point on
yes
because all the flowers had a little erm sort of dimple in them at the bottom so that you could push them in with this implement and make them stand up like tulips and
yes yes
daffodils and and all sorts of plants
well I think the tulips and the daffodils actually had that little hole but I think some of them you just pushed in with your fingers
mm cabbages you did because they were little heart things
oh yes I remember the cabbages
like tiny Brussels sprouts
yes we may have had something a bit tall that might have been Brussels sprout we had something would a Brussels sprout have a sort of a a small cabbagey head at the top?

well a Brussels sprout grows up a stem it would have leaves at the bottom and it might have a bit of that on the top but I don't know that we I don't think we had the runner bean because I didn't remember the frames
mm mm mm I remember something that kept falling over
I don't know I can't remember that
but the vegetables all came in my time with the garden pond
they were later yes
whereas you had the erm you had the flower borders and the flowers
I think I had the crazy paving
yes
greenhouse did I have the greenhouse?
I think so I I do
because the greenhouse had little tiny seed trays with I think they had little lines of green things in them or you could put or you could put little lines of green in there but there were some
oh yes yes a bit like false eyelashes
yes
obviously in green I wonder what happened to my false eyelashes
they they'd be dead once
yes I was going to say it was before that time when I was in that false eyelash era
and you got little tiny individual flower pots you could push the plants in as well
mm yes and they stood they were erm brown you know the terracotta and they stood in little grey bases with holes in didn't they?

I think they might have done because they were a bit toppley-over otherwise I do believe we I think I think there may have been the odd imported farm animal like rabbits and I think the little farm animal rabbits used to go on there and also maybe even the the sheep dog on occasion
gosh the swan oh yes and the swan the swan went and I think the round pond was used prior to getting the artistic pond
yes well it was an improvised turquoisey blue one of the tin lids that push in rather than a pushes out so that it had got colour inside yes I remember that yes I think that was an improvised pond
mm yes yes yes yes I imagine that I was given the pond after we got the pond in the garden
quite possibly
or somewhere linked in that era

I didn't start off with a pond because I had the garden set to go with my Bayko set which would be considered as a a very dangerous thing for small children to play with now because it had rods metal rods you put in holes and slid the bricks down so there's all those spikey things you can stick yourself on
no mm yes yes and the flooring that sort of brown sort of not really plastic but something a bit earlier
it was green the erm base was a greeny
the oh the big green base but I meant
you put the poles in
you put the poles in and then you put the first floor in
yes you had the poles
then you put some brown stuff in to support your corners
oh yes you you had erm I don't know what it was made of it was it wasn't exactly plastic it was sort of a cross between plastic and a a kind of like erm oil cloth in it it was sort of
they probably hadn't invented plastic as we know it we are pre Lego here

no it looked a bit like it looked like a bit something you might like carburettor things with punched holes in the old days erm I think yes you put those in for the fl to support just to keep the you had to keep your poles in because if you were doing something tall you had to keep slip they had all little punched holes in so you slid them over your poles so that your upper storey the poles were in the right place to retain the bricks as they slid in because otherwise if you got got taller they could possibly not be as tight at the top as they were at the bottom until you actually put the roof on so you needed some sort of erm intervening strengthening oh and that's right and and it had the different the different roofs and you could have erm er what do you call it? you could have erm a thing over a bay window er what do you call them? a dor not a dormer window erm I've forgotten the term
mm velux?
no it was er like you have over a bay window that you've got the roof coming down and then you've got the the angled piece that sticks out over the bay I've forgotten what they are called now
mm mm oh me too me too
one of those anyway you put those fancy bits on the roof to build out a a bay window
mm ah oh yes yes you actually stood the roof was a whole thing wasn't it? a roof
well the big roofs were solid
so you had to buy roo you had to build houses to fit your roofs

yes but you could only build houses that were on the right grid on a grid pattern you couldn't make a an odd half inch somewhere so it had to be in the proportions of that but you could make up your own there's a whole book of erm designs of houses and castles and things you could garages and all sorts of things you could build but you could do freehand as well as long as you considered what components you'd got because I did have several roofs and there were also flat bits that you could make that you could possibly use as a garage or flat or you could put two of them together to make a small er pitched roof I mean pitched you know with a yes and there were different bays and things but I don't know how old that was because it was used before me I think 's friend had Bayko because he's the only person I've ever talked about Bayko with because he's only well he's the same age as so he was what? maybe two years younger than me but he's got older sisters or they may have had it I don't know
yes no mm mm mm mm mm oh mm mm oh yes mm yes because families if you if you are the eldest or youngest it would make a big difference wouldn't it?

you know so thinking that it was really from another era because I used to play with it when I was quite small you used to play with it when you were quite small didn't you? because I used to make houses for the likes of and small erm the small pipe cleaner dolls from the dolls' house and things I think I used to put those in you know
mm mm mm oh mm you see I had I had Lego too
and you had Lego yes
but Lego wasn't as wasn't as adaptable when it first came out because you only had the big size bricks but there's hundreds of ways that they erm but the what are we calling it? the building set
mm you get Lego people now don't you? mountains and all sorts bayko
Bayko would be dangerous

well there was all the small pieces because you could get they were they were quite thin or maybe half inch half inch square but only about quarter of an inch thin they were the ones that slotted in in red and white and then you could get ones that were just half the size of that or even thinner just for doing different bits stripes in brickwork or bits to fill in bays and they were very tiny
mm mm yes yes yes I didn't like the the poles those metal poles
and you got different size poles because you are going to need shorter poles for some things
yes there was quite a lot to it wasn't there?
mm that's right because dad made that nice erm box
I wonder where he got it from?
I don't know
perhaps somebody at school had it
it's possible it could have come from the because they were quite well off because it wasn't a cheap toy
was he older than you?
yes
oh that would possibly be it then
and he was a boy I don't know so it may have come that way I don't think it was 's because it was quite an expensive toy
yes mm no it might have come from the
or somewhere somebody in that neck of the woods erm
yes yes and wouldn't necessarily pass it on because he'd have
mm that's right
but the is a possibility isn't it? because he was more into more into motors wasn't he that boy?
and he was an only boy and he hadn't got a brother
yes when the boy got fed up with it he would pass it on
mm because it all came in it came in various bits of cardboard boxes and things and father father made that
and did father yes
well he got all the things out and saw how many there were and then constructed the box so it would fit in because you had to put it back in the right compartments

mm mm keeps his screws or has kept his screws in a box of a sort of a similar but had the handle but I think he now keeps them in something because it's alright if you are working all the time on them but there are all sorts of problems like if you you know it doesn't have a top and things
yes mm there are two upstairs with tops of 's
oh 's tried lots of different kinds
it says transistors up the side but it is er I think he was putting stuff gradually things into them
yes well if you have any that will get thrown away it's worth offering them and it's worth thinking around if you could use them for other things like cottons or needles or something

mm yes well this is it I mean I've got I've got loads of erm nuts and bolts and screws and nails and things that I need to sort of my own because some of my stuff is here and some of my stuff is at 's and the same with my tools they are in two different places oh I must bring those tools up from the cellar to 's you know hammers and pliers
mm yes yes yes yes lots to do
yes I don't want to throw any tools away well not throw them away I don't want to give them away necessarily
no no you need to sort them out

because 's engineer's tool kit thing he took around with him has got really useful little types of erm long nose pliers and pliers with bent noses which are really useful because you can put them in and pick something out that's not immediately in front of you and so on if you're because they were for going in you know if you want to move little wires in a jumble of wires inside a a computer box you could actually get hold of things so I would like to keep those because I don't know anybody who I could pass them onto really
mm mm yes mm no it's all about finding good homes for things
I was always using his tool kit so I don't think he would mind
anyway I guess we probably ought to be getting ready for going out now what do you think?
I think so yes if we don't get blown away getting into the car
gosh it is really rough out there today isn't it?
mm I'm not going to go along the road with the big trees
no
that occasionally fall down and bits come off
enough trouble with your own trees but we can go round the back can't we?
yes
well okay let me just er tidy this off then
